title: General form
text: If "w varies inversely with the square of d" then the general form of our relationship will be $$w=\frac{k}{d^2}$$.

title: Finding k
text: The constant k can be found by multiplying $$w d^2$$.

title: Evaluating k
text: k $$=w d^2$$. If $$w=50$$ when $$d=3960$$, what is k?

title: Finding new distance
text: Now we know our relationship is $$w=\frac{784080000}{d^2}$$. To find the new weight if it were $$3970$$ miles from Earth's center, plug in $$d=3970!$$ Round to three decimal places.
